summary:
Trainer Delia is here!  About halfway into the first year of 
Ash's Championhood, Delia decides to be honest with Ash, and...
caption:
Trainer Delia is here!

About halfway into the first year of Ash’s Championhood, Delia decides to be honest with Ash, and express that she’s a little weary of her long-running day-to-day routine; that she wishes she could see the world, the way she wanted to when she was a little girl.

Sadly, back then, she was left to manage the Pallet House more-or-less by herself, grounding her from taking a journey of her own.

Ash encourages Delia to take some time off and go on that adventure, but she’s hesitant; she has the restaurant, and the house to take care of!  On a whim, Ash decides he’ll move out of the house and find his own place to live, and take some pressure off his mother to do as she pleases.

Delia temporarily closes the Pallet House, and leaves Pallet Town to try her hand at being a pokemon trainer! It’s never too late to try, after all!

Mr.Mime, naturally, joins Delia as her partner. She receives a Bulbasaur from Professor Oak, and Ash gifts her a Riolu egg to start with.

summary: Pokemon Card of the Day #1312: Sceptile (Arceus #31)
title: Pokemon Card of the Day #1312: Sceptile (Arceus #31)
body:
Amazingly enough, there was a second Sceptile card in the Arceus set. This was a bit surprising for a Pokemon from a different generation than the then-current one, but this Sceptile apparently came from a Japanese theme deck that got added to the Arceus set in the international release. Many of these theme deck cards weren’t meant to be all that great, but this one at least had the ability to dish out a bunch of damage. Doing so consistently was another story.

Sceptile’s 130 HP was a pretty good number, one you’d expect out of a Stage 2 and just enough to take a couple of hits from some of the less-powerful decks out there. A +30 Fire Weakness was a bit annoying, especially against Blaziken FB LV.X, though it didn’t make a difference in every game due to the difference in Blaziken’s damage output and Sceptile’s HP number. Other Fire decks were quite rare at the time, so the Weakness could have been much worse. The -20 Water Resistance was very nice. It was especially useful against Kingdra and forced Gyarados to be at full power to KO in 2 hits. Sceptile could retreat for a single Energy, which was very nice.

Leaf Supply dealt 30 damage for a Grass Energy and let you attach a basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokemon. This was a decent early-game attack to help get your side more fully set up. It was pretty poor later on, however.

Dual Cut could either be amazing, good, or terrible. For the cost of a Grass and 2 Colorless Energy, there were 2 coin flips. Each heads flip did 70 damage. There was a 25% chance of 140 damage here, which was a KO against anything relevant! There was also a 50% chance of a solid 70 damage. Sadly, the other 25% resulted in Sceptile doing nothing but wasting a turn, which was just awful and made this an incredibly risky card.

Sceptile was a card that would win some games. A good flipping streak would let this hang in with the best decks out there. It would also lose sometimes to the weakest opponents due to a bad streak, which made this a poor choice for anything but the most casual scenarios. What resulted from this was a card that was both scary and not worth using at the same time.

blog.name: weirdandwackypokefusions
blog.title: Well that's strange!
blog.description:
Welcome!  I create, using the all-mighty classic Microsoft XP Paint, my own pokemon fusions. All the sprites come from pokestadium and usually people on deviantart/ the xy/sun&moon sprite project. I don't own any of the sprite used, I just fuse them! 
REQUESTS ARE OPEN! Ask Box: 3/15.
PLEASE FEEL FREE TO DRAW MY FUSIONS!!  I absolutely love it when people draw them! There's no need to ask either! Just make sure you tag me so them I can see it!
I hope you enjoy my fusions!

summary: Xurkirona Xurkitree and Volcarona fusion Electric/Bug Type Ability: Electric Surge Stats: HP - 90, Atk - 75, Def - 75, SpA -...
caption:
Xurkirona

Xurkitree and Volcarona fusion

Electric/Bug Type

Ability: Electric Surge

Stats: HP - 90, Atk - 75, Def - 75, SpA - 175, SpD - 90, Spe - 105

The Cable Bug Pokemon

This pokefusion will drain the electricity from homes in order to gain energy for its wings. Many people have misinterpreted it as an angel due to its wings. 

Request for @offshore4am. I hope you like it. Sorry that it’s taken a while.

summary: What is the usual temperament/common behavioral problems with Leafeon?
question: What is the usual temperament/common behavioral problems with Leafeon?
answer:
Leafeon tend to be subtle in their communication, so they may make it clear they are unhappy and about to get proactive about this fact, but no one else will understand the warning.

Leafeon yowl when looking for a mate. Usually when the sun first rises, but any bright light (like a streetlamp) may cause this behavior at undesirable hours.

Leafeon mark their territory with deep cuts. Many sorry sheets of drywall can attest to this.
